story:
Corner Pocket - ACT I

(Dark stage.  Sound of a solid pool break, balls dropping into pockets.  This resolves into thunder.)


(A spotlight slowly up on MANAYUNK ELLISON O’HARA, an athletic, angular woman in her early thirties.  There’s a hardness to her, but also a fear… she’s not sure how to handle this spotlight, what it means, where it’s coming from, where she is.  She wears a wedding dress.)


    MANAYUNK

Hello?  Anyone?

Hello?


    (She looks down at her wedding dress, like “what the hell.”)


        MANAYUNK (squinting up at the spotlight.)

Hey!  Where am I?


    SPIRIT ANIMAL (voice, booming and slightly distorted, from overhead)

You don’t recognize it?


        MANAYUNK

How can I recognize anything, I’ve got a light shining in my face—who are you?


        SPIRIT ANIMAL (voice)

You’ve had quite a shock.


        MANAYUNK

What happened to me?


        SPIRIT ANIMAL (voice)

You died.


The Play

Corner Pocket began its life in 2006, the same year as Extant Arts Company. Since then it's been through numerous workshops, first at Princeton University and then in New York City. Now Extant Arts is very proud to present its World Premiere!


Synopsis: World-famous pool shark Manayunk O'Hara is having a rough week- her husband's cheating, her arch-rival's on the rise, and to make matters worse, she's just been murdered. Trapped in the Afterlife with only her sanctimonious Spirit Animal for company, Manayunk has one thing on her mind...REVENGE!



Featuring:

Alexandra Hellquist, James Liebman, Virginia Logan, Kari Swenson Riely, Mary Schneider, Eric Sutton*

 

Set Design                           Lighting Design                Sound Design

Jeremy C. Doucette               Elizabeth A. Coco                Jared Singer

 

Costume Design                Puppet Design                    Production Stage Manager

Tristan Raines                      Chana Porter                        Anna Burnham*

 

 

*Appearing courtesy of Actors’ Equity Association

An AEA Showcase Production


Our Story

Extant Arts is a small, hard-working band of theatre artists and professionals who have made it their mission to bring to life classic plays and help to develop new plays with classical themes. We need your help - our friends, families, strangers, and audience - to help us make this play!  (And your donations are tax-deductible!)


Since its founding in 2006, Extant Arts Company has presented high-quality productions from the classical canon coupled with exciting and profound new work in venues throughout the New York metropolitan area. Committed to continued engagement with enduring stories, Extant's dedicated artists and staff have explored the works of such luminaries as Euripides, Shakespeare, Chekhov, and Ibsen, as well as contemporary voices like Rebecca Gilman, and Ellen McLaughlin, all while working with schools to foster a passion for theatre in the next generation.

The Impact

It is one of Extant's highest priorities to nurture and support developing artists, which we do through our in-school education programs, dark night reading series, and full productions, like this one.

We at Extant Arts are thrilled to be presenting Andy James Hoover's New York premiere Corner Pocket.  We have had the pleasure of collaborating with Andy in the past, and we could not be more excited to bring his phenomenal new play to New York.

In supporting Extant's first fully-staged World Premiere you support us in bringing new work to life. We believe developing new theatre is vital to the lifeblood of the artistic community, and we hope you will help us continue in this important endeavor.


What We Need

$15 buys snowglobes in bulk for the show (you'll understand when you see it)

$50 pays for gels for the theatre's lights

$100 prints scripts for our team (double sided, we promise!)

$175 creates a cast of handmade shadow puppet characters for "The Trial Scene"

$200 pays for the props for the show

$300 costumes our cast

$1,000 pays for all our programs and postcards

$1,200 pays our talented designers (lights, sound, costumes, set, props, phew!)


Other Ways You Can Help

1)  Come and see CORNER POCKET October 7 - 23, Thursday through Saturday at 8 pm, Sunday, October 9 & 16 at 7pm, Sunday, October 23 at 3pm at the Gene Frankel (24 Bond Street, just off Lafayette)

2)  Volunteer to help out with marketing, production, fundraising, or ushering

3)  Let others know you donated to our campaign by clicking the share buttons to post to Facebook, Twitter, etc.

For more information on all of these ways to help, check out our website: www.extantarts.org


To Claim Your Perks

Email Kate at kate.stahl@extantarts.org at least one week in advance of the show you are planning to attend (even more time is better) so we have the chance to prepare something special for you!

More on Who We Are

Our Mission: The word 'extant' means 'enduring, not destroyed or lost,' and it is the charge and passion of Extant Arts Company to engage with theatre that has endured, and make sure that such works are not lost to present or future audiences. By reinterpreting classic stories through live performance and fostering the classics of the future through adaptation, new play development, and educational outreach, Extant Arts Company strives to create a diverse community dedicated to sustaining stories.

$1,200 pays our talented designers (lights, sound, costumes, set, props, phew!)


Other Ways You Can Help
1)  Come and see CORNER POCKET October 7 - 23, Thursday through Saturday at 8 pm, Sunday, October 9 & 16 at 7pm, Sunday, October 23 at 3pm at the Gene Frankel (24 Bond Street, just off Lafayette)2)  Volunteer to help out with marketing, production, fundraising, or ushering3)  Let others know you donated to our campaign by clicking the share buttons to post to Facebook, Twitter, etc.For more information on all of these ways to help, check out our website: www.extantarts.org



To Claim Your PerksEmail Kate at kate.stahl@extantarts.org at least one week in advance of the show you are planning to attend (even more time is better) so we have the chance to prepare something special for you!More on Who We AreOur Mission: The word 'extant' means 'enduring, not destroyed or lost,' and it is the charge and passion of Extant Arts Company to engage with theatre that has endured, and make sure that such works are not lost to present or future audiences. By reinterpreting classic stories through live performance and fostering the classics of the future through adaptation, new play development, and educational outreach, Extant Arts Company strives to create a diverse community dedicated to sustaining stories.

story:
"Sister Cities" by Colette Freedman

Four estranged sisters return to their childhood home for what appears to be a wake; yet, what turns into a family drama that will unearth old animosities and new secrets that will change them forever.

The Dramatists Guild recently named playwright, Colette Freedman, one of the “Top 50 Playwrights to Watch”. She is also a finalist in the Eugene O’Neil playwrighting competition and the first place winner for creative writing at Santa Barbara’s Writer’s Conference 2006. She has written many plays and has had 15 of them produced around the world.

Our Show Dates

We will be performing at the Underground Theatre (Annex) on the following dates:

  • Preview show: Thursday, June 7 @ 8:30 PM
  • Saturday, June 23 @ 2:30 PM & 8:30 PM
  • Sunday, June 24 @ 11:30am & 5:30 PM

View our Hollywood Fringe Page here: http://www.hollywoodfringe.org/projects/857

The Impact

Did you know that only 20% of plays written by women got produced in the 2010-2011 year? There are 40% female playwrights according to the Drama Guild and 47% according to the Alliance of Los Angeles Playwrights. In the 2010-2011 year, Broadway did not produce a single play written by women even though female plays have been shown to make more money than male written plays. (See for reference: http://blogs.indiewire.com/womenandhollywood/gu...)

Stages Theater LA is devoted to producing works that "level the playing field" for all artists - no matter what gender or ethnicity.  By producing "Sister Cities", we are providing opportunities for female playwrights and female actors to share their talents with the world.

What We Need

We need aproximately $2000 to cover the following:

  • Venue/Insurance
  • Rights to the play
  • Fringe Registration Fee
  • Publicity
  • Programs
  • If we don't reach our goal, Indie GoGo will take 9% of what you give us. If we do reach our goal, Indie GoGo only gets 4%

We want to make this production affordable and enjoyable for all members of the community.  So the less that we have to worry about paying the bills, the cheaper we can make our tickets!  Any profits that we make from this production will go towards funding future productions for Stages Theatre.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are having a Bar/Karaoke Night this coming Thursday, April 26 at the Backstage Bar and Grill in Culver City!  For details on the event, check out the Facebook event page: http://www.facebook.com/events/162675343855636/
 
We know that times are tough.  So if you cannot make a donation, please help us out by at least spreading the word to as many people as you can.  "Like" this page on Facebook, tweet it out, blog, and email people you know - whatever you can to get the word out.  We would also love your help through volunteering or being a member.  We are always looking for more fun and creative people to join our theatre company.  If you are interested, please contact either Katie Bowman or Heldine Aguiluz.
